quiz_metadata.title: Linked Lists and Song Player Implementation
quiz_metadata.description: This quiz covers the implementation of a song player using linked lists, as discussed in the video.

questions.question_text: What data structure is used to implement the song queue in the SongPlayer class?
questions.explanation: The SongPlayer class uses a LinkedList to implement the song queue, as seen in the constructor at 00:52.

questions.question_text: What is the purpose of the addSong method in the SongPlayer class?

options.text: To remove a song from the queue
To play the next song in the queue
To add a song to the end of the queue

questions.explanation: The addSong method is used to add a song to the end of the queue, as seen at 01:07.

questions.question_text: What happens when the playNextSong method is called on an empty song queue?

options.text: It returns the first song in the queue
It adds a new song to the queue

questions.explanation: The playNextSong method returns null when the song queue is empty, as seen at 01:18.

questions.question_text: What is the purpose of the SongPlayerDemo class?

options.text: To implement the song player functionality
To demonstrate the usage of the SongPlayer class
To test the performance of the song player
To create a user interface for the song player

questions.explanation: The SongPlayerDemo class is used to demonstrate the usage of the SongPlayer class, as seen at 01:50.

questions.question_text: How many songs are added to the song player in the SongPlayerDemo class?
questions.explanation: 100,000 songs are added to the song player in the SongPlayerDemo class, as seen at 02:27.

questions.question_text: What is the time taken to play 100,000 songs using a LinkedList?
questions.explanation: The time taken to play 100,000 songs using a LinkedList is 225 milliseconds, as seen at 03:19.

questions.question_text: What happens when an ArrayList is used instead of a LinkedList in the SongPlayer class?
questions.explanation: The performance degrades when an ArrayList is used instead of a LinkedList, as seen at 04:21.

questions.question_text: What is the time taken to play 1,000,000 songs using a LinkedList?
questions.explanation: The time taken to play 1,000,000 songs using a LinkedList is 1.2 seconds, as seen at 05:26.

questions.question_text: Why is a LinkedList more suitable for the song player implementation than an ArrayList?

options.text: Because it provides faster search times
Because it provides faster insertion and deletion times
Because it provides more memory efficiency
Because it provides better caching performance

questions.explanation: A LinkedList is more suitable for the song player implementation because it provides faster insertion and deletion times, which is important for a song player that needs to frequently add and remove songs.

questions.question_text: What is the main advantage of using a LinkedList in the song player implementation?
questions.explanation: The main advantage of using a LinkedList in the song player implementation is the faster insertion and deletion times, which is critical for a song player that needs to frequently add and remove songs.
